excerpt: Open-air temple known for its massive statue of a reclining Buddha, one of the largest in the world.
detail_description: Mahattamangkalaram Temple (Wat Hat Yai Nai) is a remarkable open-air temple in Hat Yai, featuring one of the largest reclining Buddha statues in the world. The 35-meter long statue, crafted in the 1970s, is a sight to behold as you enter the temple grounds. It's a peaceful attraction amidst the bustling city and is popular among multi-generation families. You may also encounter school children paying their respects in their uniforms during afternoon visits.
name: Mahattamangkalaram Temple (Wat Hat Yai Nai)
address: 2 Wathatyainai Rd, ต.หาดใหญ่, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Covered market with clothing & souvenir stalls, plus vendors selling classic Thai dishes & drinks.
detail_description: ASEAN Night Bazaar Hatyai is a bustling covered market that attracts both locals and tourists, offering a wide array of clothing, souvenirs, and classic Thai dishes. Spread over two floors, this night market is particularly popular among Muslim travelers. The ground floor features stalls selling affordable clothes, shoes, watches, and beauty products like facial masks with samples for testing. While prices may be higher compared to other markets in the area, visitors can still try their hand at bargaining.
name: ASEAN Night Bazaar Hatyai
address: 76 Chotevittayakul 3 Rd, Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Vibrant, tented marketplace featuring stalls selling snacks & of-the-moment fashion & accessories.
detail_description: Greenway Night Market is a lively and colorful marketplace with various stalls offering trendy fashion items, accessories, and delicious snacks. It's a popular spot in Hat Yai where locals and tourists can explore the latest fashion trends while indulging in local delicacies. The market provides an exciting shopping experience with its vibrant atmosphere and diverse offerings. Additionally, it's conveniently located within the city, making it easily accessible for visitors to enjoy an evening of shopping and dining.
name: Greenway Night Market
address: 1406, 3 ถนน กาญจนวณิชย์, Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Busy, no-nonsense marketplace with many vendors of imported snacks, dried fruits & souvenirs.
detail_description: Kim Yong Market is a bustling and no-nonsense marketplace in Hat Yai, Thailand. It offers a wide variety of goods, including imported snacks, dried fruits, souvenirs, fresh produce, seafood, and street food. The market is known for its vibrant atmosphere and is a popular spot for locals and tourists alike to explore the diverse range of products available. Additionally, it's located near several dining options where visitors can enjoy delicious Malaysian and Southern Thai cuisine after their shopping spree at the market.
name: Kim Yong Market
address: ตลาดกิมหยง, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Ice Dome Hat Yai is a unique attraction situated near the cable car at Hat Yai Park. It has gained popularity among local Thai tourists and holds the distinction of being Thailand's first ice dome. Visitors find it to be an interesting place worth exploring during their visit to Hat Yai.
name: Ice Dome Hat Yai
address: 445 Petchakasem Rd, Kho Hong, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Cable Car Hat Yai City offers a unique experience with its surrounding area featuring a massive golden Buddha statue at the main entrance. While the cable car may not always be operational, visitors can walk or drive to the top for stunning views of the city and enjoy strong winds. The one-way trip provides picturesque views from the hillside to Hatyai city. Additionally, visitors can take a short but steep walk up to the top when maintenance is ongoing.
name: Cable Car Hat Yai City
address: Unnamed Rd, Tambon Kho Hong Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Wat Chue Chang, located in Hat Yai city, is a symbol of the Chinese community's influence in the area. The temple features beautiful architecture and intricate detailing, with a distinctive green gate that makes it a local landmark. While under renovation during some visits, the temple boasts colorful decorations on its walls and tiles, making it a great spot for photos. Its unique style combines Chinese influences with traditional Thai design elements.
name: Wat Chue Chang
address: 118 Supasarnrangsan Rd, Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Bustling market featuring vendors offering clothing, electronics, housewares & street food.
detail_description: Santisuk Market is a bustling and vibrant market located within walking distance from Hatyai town center. It offers a wide range of products, including clothing, electronics, housewares, and street food. Visitors can explore stalls selling electronic goods, apparel, cosmetics, leather products, souvenirs, local dried products, and snacks. The market is popular among families as it provides an opportunity to shop for clothing, accessories, toys, and fresh produce while also indulging in local street food.
name: Santisuk Market
address: นิ พั ท ธุ์, Nipatuthit 2 Rd, Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Contemporary natural history museum with many specimens, marine dioramas & dinosaur exhibits.
detail_description: The Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn Natural History Museum in Hat Yai is a contemporary museum offering a diverse range of exhibits. It is located within the Songkhla University compound and features three floors dedicated to Earth Study, Diversity of Life, and Ecosystem. The museum boasts an impressive collection of zoological and geological samples, stuffed animals, marine dioramas, dinosaur exhibits, human evolution displays, and geological formations.
name: Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn Natural History Museum
address: พิพิธภัณฑสถานธรรมชาติวิทยา ๕๐ พรรษา สยามบรมราชกุมารี, 15 ถ.กาญจนวณิชย์, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Quirky city park with religious statues, gondola rides, pedal boating, playgrounds & sweeping views.
detail_description: Hatyai City Municipal Park is a popular attraction in Hat Yai, Thailand, known for its diverse offerings. The park features religious statues, gondola rides, pedal boating, playgrounds, and stunning panoramic views. One of its highlights is the towering Buddha statue at the entrance, standing at 20 meters tall and weighing about 200 tons. Visitors can escape the city's hustle and bustle to immerse themselves in nature within the park's serene lakes and green spaces.
name: Hatyai City Municipal Park
address: Kanjanavanich Rd, Tambon Kho Hong, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Hat Yai, a city in Thailand's far south near the Malaysian border, is a sprawling commercial hub and shopping destination. At the Khlong Hae Floating Market, vendors sell local foods and handicrafts from traditional boats docked in a canal. The Wat Hat Yai Nai temple is known for its 35m-long reclining Buddha. Outside the city center, Hat Yai Park is a hilly green area with a standing Buddha statue and a cable car.
detail_description: Hat Yai, a bustling city in southern Thailand near the Malaysian border, is renowned for its vibrant commercial scene and as a shopper's paradise. The Khlong Hae Floating Market offers an authentic experience with local delicacies and crafts sold from traditional boats along the canal. Visitors can marvel at the impressive 35-meter reclining Buddha at Wat Hat Yai Nai temple or explore the green expanse of Hat Yai Park, featuring a standing Buddha statue and a cable car.
name: Hat Yai
address: Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Lee Gardens Plaza Shopping Mall is a part of an upscale hotel in the heart of the city, offering lavish guestrooms, spacious banquet halls, rooftop swimming pools, and a gym. The mall features well-decorated stalls selling reasonably priced goods and handmade art pieces. Visitors can enjoy local Thai cuisine on the lower ground floor and explore street food options outside the mall. Additionally, one floor is dedicated to art exhibitions, adding a cultural touch to Hatyai's old town.
name: Lee Gardens Plaza Shopping Mall
address: 2F4C+5MP, Tambon Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Food stalls, an aviary & a pavilion on a pond are installed amid sculpture & flower gardens.
detail_description: Kho Hong Mountain Viewpoint is a must-visit spot in Hatyai, offering a refreshing green landscape and stunning panoramic views of the city. Perched atop Kho Hong Hill, this viewpoint provides an excellent vantage point to capture breathtaking sights of Hatyai from above. The tallest Buddha or Guan Yin statue can be seen from here. With its maximum height reaching 380 meters, the hill also contributes to increased rainfall in the area.
name: Kho Hong Mountain vista point
address: 2GR6+853, Unnamed Road, Kho Hong, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Chen Loong Boat Noodle is a renowned noodle restaurant in Hat Yai, offering delicious beef braised soup noodles. The place is known for its authentic boat noodles loaded with pork slices and meatballs. The portion sizes are typical of Thai meals, and the well-seasoned broth of beef with a hint of herbs makes for a delightful dining experience. Additionally, patrons can enjoy robust and hot coffee, which is not commonly found at noodle shops.
name: Cheng Long Noodles
address: 167 Sangchan Rd, Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Easygoing eatery with a down-to-earth vibe offering dim sum for breakfast & evening meals.
detail_description: Chokdee Dim Sum is a laid-back restaurant in Hat Yai that serves delicious dim sum for breakfast and dinner. Located in the bustling urban area where Thailand and Malaysia meet, this eatery offers an unpretentious atmosphere. With its affordable prices, it's a great spot to enjoy authentic dim sum dishes. If you're looking for a casual dining experience with tasty food, Chokdee Dim Sum is definitely worth a visit during your time in Hat Yai.
name: Chokdee Dim Sum
address: 58, 25 Lamaisongkrew Rd, Tambon Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

name: Lee Garden Night Market
address: 2F4C+9JR, Tambon Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Big C Extra Hatyai 2 is a modern shopping complex where you can find everyday goods at Thai prices. There are two main Big C complexes in Hat Yai, along with several mini-shops in other locations. Visitors can explore a variety of products, including snacks and household items wrapped in Thai packaging. The outlet offers a range of items such as hand-wash sensors, sink cups, and even chandeliers.
name: Big C Extra Hatyai 2
address: 677 Phet Kasem Rd, Kho Hong, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Landmark tower on a plaza known for markets with street food stalls, clothes, cosmetics & homewares.
detail_description: Hatyai Clock Tower is a prominent landmark situated in a bustling plaza renowned for its vibrant markets offering an array of street food stalls, clothing, cosmetics, and homewares. Visitors can explore the market to purchase affordable souvenirs, clothes, and local delicacies such as laksa. Additionally, the area serves as a convenient transportation hub for travelers arriving at Hatyai train station. The clock tower plaza is known for its accessibility to white vans providing affordable rides to Songkhlan.
name: Hat Yai Clock Tower
address: Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Central Festival Watson Exit is the largest mall in Hatyai, offering free parking and a wide range of shopping and entertainment options. Spanning an impressive 250,000 square meters, the mall houses 250 retail shops where visitors can find everything from clothing and accessories to food, jewelry, and games. It's a popular hangout spot for locals and tourists alike due to its diverse offerings and convenient location.
name: Central festival Watson exit
address: XFRM+J83, Tambon Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

name: ก๋วยเตี๋ยวเรือชูเจริญChoo Ja Roean Boat Noodles
address: 225, 17 Supasarnrangsan Rd, Tambon Hat Yai, Amphoe Hat Yai, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

name: The Central Mosque of Songkhla
address: 352 หมู่ที่, Lopburi Ramesuan Rd, Khlong Hae, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Waterside market with vendors selling Thai street food, drinks & souvenirs from boats.
detail_description: Khlong Hae Floating Market is a lively weekend market where vendors sell a variety of Thai street food, drinks, and souvenirs from boats. The market opens at 2 pm on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. It's a bustling place with numerous food options such as Tom Yum Kung, fried seafood, chicken dishes, mango sticky rice, and coconut ice cream. Cash is the preferred payment method here. Visitors can also find stalls on land selling souvenirs and clothing items.
name: Khlong Hae Floating Market
address: ถ.คลองแห-คูเต่า, Khlong Hae, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: The Containers Cafe is a popular spot in Hatyai, known for its creative and visually stunning drinks like tea cubes and half-parfait-half-frappe concoctions. The Japanese-style honey toast and a variety of desserts are also highly recommended. The cafe's ambiance is cozy, attracting many students from the nearby university who come to study. With its loft-style high ceiling and open layout, it offers a comfortable setting for coffee lovers.
name: The Containers Cafe
address: 8 Kanjanavanich Rd, Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Foresto Cafe is a charming out-of-town spot with a picturesque view of the forestry yard. The cafe offers an interesting selection of drinks and coffee, along with well-portioned and delicious cakes like Almond Chocolate Tart and Carrot Cake. Visitors can enjoy a variety of beverages including Italian soda, coffee, and tea. The owner speaks excellent English, making it convenient for foreign visitors. While the cafe is cozy with good coffee and warm service, some find it too small and hot inside.
name: Foresto Cafe'
address: 2, 2 Sripoovanart Nai Rd, Khuan Lang, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

name: Wat Khok Saman Khun
address: 10 Chokesaman 3 Rd, Tambon Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Masjid Sahe Pakistan, located in the Hat Yai district of Songkhla Province, is a nearly 100-year-old mosque that serves as a Muslim prayer place for both men and women. It also houses an office that fosters relationships between Thai Muslims and Pakistan. The mosque welcomes people from diverse backgrounds and cultures for Friday prayers, offering sermons in Thai, Arabic, and Urdu.
name: Masjid Sahe Pakistan
address: 40 Cheumrat Rd, Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Hat Yai is a vibrant city in southern Thailand known for its bustling markets, delicious street food, and lively nightlife. Visitors can explore the colorful Kim Yong Market, sample local dishes at the bustling night bazaar, and experience the energetic atmosphere of Lee Garden Plaza. The city also offers opportunities for cultural immersion at the Phra Maha Chedi Tripob Trimongkol and Wat Hat Yai Nai temples.
name: Hat Yai
address: Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Pruksa Park is a lovely spot to spend a few hours, especially if you're interested in the park itself rather than the Wine Village. You can take beautiful pictures and interact with animals like goats, horses, and rabbits. However, some visitors noted that the animals seemed a bit neglected. The entry is free, making it an ideal place to visit with kids and capture memorable moments. There are facilities such as toilets and washing areas available.
name: Pruksa Park
address: 2F5Q+R3Q, Prachayindee Rd, Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: The Viewpoint behind the Hat Yai Observatory is a fascinating place located near Hatyai Municipal Park. It features intriguing photos and illustrations about the universe, along with telescopes for stargazing after sunset. The area offers a beautiful mountain view, especially during foggy weather. Visitors can enjoy the peaceful atmosphere and even camp overnight to experience the serene surroundings. Additionally, there are hiking trails of varying lengths for those who love outdoor activities.
name: Viewpoint behind the Hat Yai Observatory
address: 2GQ6+FMQ, Kho Hong, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

name: Hatyai Deepsky Observation for Science and Astronomy
address: 2GR6+3P8, Kho Hong, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: If you're looking for an authentic Thai massage experience, look no further than จันทร์นิภา ("Jan Nipa" Thai Massage) in Hat Yai, Thailand. This cozy and clean spa offers individual curtain partitions for privacy and is also suitable for families. The friendly and courteous staff provide excellent service, ensuring a truly relaxing experience. Visitors praise the skilled therapists and the affordable prices, making it a great value for money.
name: จันทร์นิภา ("Jan Nipa" Thai Massage)
address: 27 Yunyong Patana Alley, Tambon Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: S WEED UPPER 420 HATYAI Weed Cannabis Coffee Dispensary Cafe Shop is a 24-hour spot with friendly and knowledgeable staff. The place offers a variety of cannabis products at affordable prices, and the owner is known for being generous with freebies. In addition to its cannabis offerings, the shop also serves excellent coffee, making it an ideal spot for both stoners and coffee lovers. Customers have praised the comfortable environment, good drinks, and chill music.
name: S WEED UPPER 420 HATYAI Weed Cannabis Coffee Dispensary Cafe Shop
address: JT square plaza 4แยก ไดอาน่า ตรงที่ขายผ้าเยอะๆ เลียบ, ถนน 30 เมตร, Tambon Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: The Angela Queena Cabaret Show is a must-see theater performance in Hat Yai, featuring local artists and cultural dances. The show takes place on the 6th floor of Odean Shopping Mall and lasts about an hour. With beautiful performances, stunning lighting, and elaborate costumes, it offers an entertaining experience. Despite being relatively unknown, the show boasts impressive choreography and a diverse range of talents. While attendance may vary, the dedication of the performers shines through in their captivating acts.
name: Angela Queena Cabaret Show
address: Thumnoonvithi Rd, : Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: If you're wandering through the vibrant streets of Hat Yai, make sure to stop by the New Season Massage Center - ศูนย์นวดแผนโบราณ โรงแรมนิวซีซั่น. This gem offers an incredible experience at remarkably affordable prices, with a 90-minute full massage for just 300 baht! The ambiance is peaceful and clean, providing a perfect escape after a day of exploring.
name: New season Massage Center - ศูนย์นวดแผนโบราณ โรงแรมนิวซีซั่น
address: 2F4F+QCM, ถนน ศุภสารรังสรรค์, Tambon Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

name: Street Art Hatyai
address: 2F39+JRQ, Thumnoonvithi Rd, Tambon Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

name: Street Art Hat Yai: Scent of the Tea, Delicious, and Happy Meal
address: 33 Sangchan Rd, Tambon Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Day Cafe HDY offers a unique experience with its concentrated green tea and cocoa drinks, as well as a slightly bitter but authentic matcha. The signature cheesecake is a must-try, boasting a fragrant, cheesy flavor with the perfect amount of sourness. While parking may be limited, the cafe's wide selection of coffee options will surely please any coffee lover. The charmingly decorated cafe also serves delicious fresh milk strawberries.
name: Day Cafe HDY
address: 603, 3 Thumnoonvithi Rd, Tambon Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

name: Hatyai Backpackers Hostel
address: 193 Nipatuthit 1 Rd, Hat Yai, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Food stalls, an aviary & a pavilion on a pond are installed amid sculpture & flower gardens.
name: Kho Hong Mountain vista point
address: 2GR6+853, Unnamed Road, Kho Hong, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Airy Buddhist temple constructed out of stainless steel with a dramatic contemporary design.
detail_description: Phra Maha Chedi Tripob Trimongkol, also known as the Stainless Steel Temple & Pagoda, is a striking Buddhist temple made entirely of stainless steel. The pagoda features a unique contemporary design with stainless steel rings and is adorned with statues and murals depicting tales of Buddha. Visitors can enjoy the tranquil sound of wind chimes on the upper level. Accessing the temple may require chartering a tuk-tuk due to its location 2.
name: Phra Maha Chedi Tripob Trimongkol
address: 2G38+XGV, Kho Hong, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Whimsical museum featuring a variety of creative, 3D wall & floor paintings, plus a magic theater.
detail_description: Magic Museum HatYai Thailand is a whimsical and entertaining attraction featuring a variety of creative 3D wall and floor paintings, as well as a captivating magic theater. It's an ideal destination for families, offering fun experiences for both kids and adults. The museum now incorporates augmented reality into its 3D art, bringing the pictures to life.
name: Magic Museum HatYai Thailand
address: 412 Kanjanavanich Rd, Tambon Kho Hong, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Our Lady of Lourdes Church, Hat Yai (லூர்து அன்னை ஆலயம்) is a Catholic church located within a 10-minute walk from the Lee Gardens Plaza Hotel. The church recently underwent renovations and offers an English Mass on Saturdays at 6:30 pm. The enthusiastic choir and charismatic priest create a welcoming atmosphere for worshippers.
name: Our Lady of Lourdes Church, Hat Yai (லூர்து அன்னை ஆலயம்)
address: 145 Thumnoonvithi Rd, Kho Hong, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Siam Art Gallery is a cozy space that primarily features the works of two artists, each with their own distinct style. While the lack of variety may be a downside for some, it's worth noting that this gallery is one of the few places in Hat Yai to appreciate art. The pieces on display are not accompanied by descriptions or price tags, suggesting they may not be for sale.
name: Siam Art Gallery
address: 54 ซอย สามพี่น้อง1 ( ใกล้ปั๊ม ปตท 108, Poonnakan Rd, Kho Hong, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

excerpt: Nature reserve in forested mountains, centered on a waterfall with viewpoints & a pool for swimming.
detail_description: Ton Nga Chang Wildlife Sanctuary is a stunning natural retreat nestled in the forested mountains of Southern Thailand, renowned for its breathtaking waterfall. This sanctuary offers visitors a refreshing escape from urban life, with opportunities to hike along various trails that cater to different skill levels. Each trail leads to picturesque waterfalls where you can take a dip and enjoy the serene surroundings. The area is also perfect for picnics, allowing you to soak up nature while enjoying delicious food amidst beautiful scenery.
name: Ton Nga Chang Wildlife Sanctuary
address: W6XM+XJC, Thung Tam Sao, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

name: Hatyai Museum
address: อาคารศูนย์ประณีตศิลป์ มหาวิทยาลัยหาดใหญ่, ตำบลคอหงส์ อำเภอหาดใหญ่ จังหวัดสงขลา, 90110, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand

detail_description: Hatyai Wonder Land is a one-stop destination for entertainment and fun, catering to all preferences. Visitors can experience the only 4D image in Asia and be captivated by an impressive show featuring Thailand's top magician, Naritthi. The magic spectacle includes astonishing acts such as making cars disappear, levitating individuals, and world-class performing arts like "Ngao Mue.
name: Hatyai Wonder Land
address: 2GV3+CMR, Kho Hong, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110, Thailand
